intro: Codia fusca, commonly known as the black codia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically dark purple or black when mature. Codia fusca is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and along stream banks.
